page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: A part of the historic village of { {Sarre}falls within this survey. In particular the site of the last ferry across the Wantsum and of the first bridge to be built, sometimes in the 15th Century.{Bridge Cottage}mark the spot. No Roman remains have been found but Sarre in the obvious spot for a { {Roman Ferrey,}as it is opposite the end of the Roman Road leading to Canterbury. Sarre was important port and settlement in Saxon days, as witness its large and rich cemetery discovered in 1864. In{Medieval}times Sarre was still a part and had a large church, St Gile's now only a foundation beneath a field. By the Reign of Henry VIII the Wantsum Channel had shrunk to the proportions of a river,but a shipwreck is mentioned.The"Cherry Brandy" House was favoured by{Dickens.
